embeds.title: Leeching Strike
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Deal 5 (8) damage.
**Consume** - Gain **Block** :p_block: equal to the enemy's **Goop** :p_goop:.

messages.content: this is the best slime boss card that I rarely take
ah yes block engine
this is like, top 5 best slimebo card
this can be a block engine
~~it's a bit like snapshot if you can get copies of it~~
depends on your deck's setup tbh

its really good in decks that can stack up goop since it just blocks for like 40 every turn. but starting at 5 damage makes this card really weak at the start of the game and it gets even weaker if you go for slimes instead. Fortunately as a common card you can reliably find it later in the game when you need it. If you wait on this card you will sometimes end never taking it because you have other goop pay of cards like Vicious tackle and Growth punch you would rather play instead.
if you focus on lick recursion via just desserts imo <goop armor> is better

embeds.title: Goop Armor
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Gain 3 (4) **Block** :p_block: whenever you **Consume.**

messages.content: despite not using this as much as some other common slime boss cards like reformation, spear tackle and leeching slime I don't deny that this card can be incredibly powerful
leeching strike is strong when you use non-lick means of gaining goop primarily
<spreading slime> with <rain of goop>, <ooze bath>, mire slime basically

embeds.title: Spreading Slime
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 2 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Effects that apply **Goop** :p_goop: apply 2 (3) more.

Having a finisher for goop that gives you block is really good
Lick recursion obviously helps with goop armor but unless the comp is <sampling lick+> and <nibble and lick+> your not getting much outta it

since you might consume when the enemy isnt attacking
If your using <douse in slime> to scale this though then you don't really care

As they both provide a lot of utility
Do I wish slime had more non exhausting split cards yes I really wish there was one in the uncommon pool
Like <repurpose> is a really mid card rn

**Absorb** - Split into a random **Specialist.**
 **Command.)**

messages.content: i cant recall the last t ime i picked repurpose
If it was non exhausting and it split into a  random normal slime (on absorb) it'd be very solid
The upgrade would allow you to choose
that would actually be useful
1 strengh + gets mid slimes out
Yeah for your combo cards like pile on divide and serve
It also doesn't just singlehandedly solve the slime problem since you still need a slime to absorb
The funny thing is repurpose would be too strong if it let you choose but right now it's really weak
+1 strength is basically nothing
EXTRA nothing since slimbo has bassicly no multihits
And since you don't get the effect of slimes until next turn your setting yourself back by adding this card to your deck instead of something useful
Glad you said basically
Cause divide and conquer has been carrying me so far
Basic setup payoff sort of deck and leeching strike is in there to help me on bad turns
Just goop stacking into a finisher
<divide and conquer>

embeds.title: Divide & Conquer
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 1 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Deal 10 (15) damage to a random enemy for each Slime.
**Absorb** all Slimes.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: this seems kinda bad
In normal combats yeah in bosses definitely not
Maybe trash against silent 2 but shhhhh
Basically this card benefits from goop 3x so stacking goop on a boss goes extremely hard with this card
It's also 1 of the 3 only attacks I have lmao
It's definitely not bad though 20 (usually) damage for a 1 cost is really good numbers especially early
You have goop to stack that multi hit into lethal range which helps out alot
Weird card cause the potential upside is very high but as far as damage commons go it leaves alot to be desired in terms of damage
Has anyone made the Iron Wave comparison yet?
This card is more like <Snapshot> IMO

Deal 6 (8) damage. **Dead On:** Gain **Block** :p_block: equal to the unblocked damage dealt.

But I think you're right
this shouldnt be a common card
its more of a synergy enabler in goop decks
and without that its kind of bad
Even without goop specific decks its decent
What uncommon would you swap it with
And also the numbers would have to be a bit higher to be an uncommon tbh
I don't think it would need to be, the strongest part is converting goop to block. The base damage is more of a secondary effect it feels like.

embeds.title: Recollect
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Gain 8 (11) **Block** :p_block:.
**Exhume** a random "Lick" card.

messages.content: normally damage equivalents are a lot bigger numbers than their block equivalents
but this one has self damage and also is only a bit higher

The damage is pretty abysmal, so you really need to make sure you can trigger the consume effect consistently to get the most out of this. Granted, slime boss has both a very large number of ways to apply goop, and quite a few of them are generically good, which means that more often than not you will be able to trigger this effect if you draft accordingly. Between mire slimes, licks, slime bath, your starting copy of corrosive spit, there are quite a few good ways to apply enough goop to get enough block to make this a good deal. With douse in slime, slime bath, spreading slime, or heavy lick recursion, this can even perform a genetic algorithm/apparition impression where it full blocks for a turn for just 1 energy, which can make it a fantastic inclusion, and it doesn't exhaust itself either. 

It's probably at it's best later in the run when you can really get goop stacking going, and where being able to block for very large numbers is more valuable. In the early game, the unreliability of the card can cost you, and the low damage will make it a liability in shorter hallway fights and races (cultist, gremlin nob, lagavulin). Great with pyramid to line up additional goop before playing it, and to hold onto it until you are getting attacked for a large amount. Upgrade is the standard +3, I can't imagine every prioritizing it.
